result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond A Franz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Threat to a Witness [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Paid in full.  Taken out of cash bond posted.
Defendant shall not possess illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.

Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall possess prescriptions only with a valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by his physician.
Defendant shall not terminate any medical/counseling appointments without approval of his treatment provider.

Ct. #1 - NC plea - 16 CF 113
Ct. #3 - NC plea - 16 CF 113

Court strikes 6 and inserts 4 on the amended information re:  Ct. #1 and Ct. #2 in 16 CF 55.
1:58 pm - brief recess to allow ADA Isherwood to prepare an amended amended information.
2:04 pm - back on the record - all parties & counsel present.
Atty. Sawyer acknowledges receipt of amended amended information - waives reading.
Court continues advising def. of his rights.
Court finds def. waives his rights, finds a factual basis exists and finds def. guilty of Ct. #1 and amended Ct. #2 in 16 CF 55.  Ct. #3, Ct. #4, and Ct. #5 D&RI and Ct. #1 and Ct. #3 in 16 CF 113.  Ct. #2 and Ct. #4 D&RI.

Counsel is ready to proceed without a further PSI.

Statements by def.
16 CF 55 - Ct. #1 - 8 years WI Prison - 4 years IC and 4 years ES
16 CF 55 - Ct. #2 - 7 years WI Prison - 4 years IC and 3 years ES
Sentences to run concurrent with one another - commence FW - 66 days credit.
16 CF 113 - Ct. #1 - 6 years WI Prison - 4 years IC and 2 years ES
16 CF 113 - Ct. #3 - 7 years WI Prison - 4 years IC and 3 years ES.
Sentences to run concurrent with one another, concurrent with 16 CF 55 and concurrent with any other sentence - 96 days credit.
Conditions of ES:
1.  def. to provide a DNA sample.
2.  pay costs of the action.
3.  def. to participate in any assessments or counseling deemed appropriate by his Agent and follow treatment recommendations arising therefrom.
4.  def. to not possess illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
5.  def. to possess prescriptions only w/a valid prescription and take in manner and method as prescribed by his physician.
6.  def. to not terminate any medical/counseling appointments w/o approval of his treatment provider.
Appeal rights explained to def.
WEDS form explained to def. - def. eligible for CIP & SAP.
Firearm restrictions explained to def.
Voter ineligibility restrictions explained to def.
Def. to not possess any body armor.
The Court directs the PSI from Outagamie County be scanned & sealed into the record.
